revisions.*: Because "rvslots" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used.

{{Lead too short|date=June 2022}} '''Synapse''' is the name of two different fictional characters appearing in [[American comic book]]s published by [[Marvel Comics]]. ==Publication history== The first Synapse, '''Max Mullins''', first appeared in ''[[Daredevil (Marvel Comics series)|Daredevil]]'' #377 (July 1998) and was created by [[Scott Lobdell]] and [[Tom Morgan (comics)|Tom Morgan]]. The second Synapse, '''Emily Guerrero''', was introduced as a new member of the [[Avengers (comics)|Avengers]]. She first appeared in ''[[Uncanny Avengers]]'' Vol. 3 #1 (December 2015) and was created by Gerry Duggan and [[Ryan Stegman]]. ==Fictional character biography== ===Max Mullins=== {{Infobox comics character |image=Max Mullins.jpg |caption= |character_name=Synapse |real_name=Max Mullins |publisher=[[Marvel Comics]] |debut=''Daredevil'' #377 (July 1998) |creators=Scott Lobdell (writer)
Tom Morgan (artist) |species=Human |homeworld= |alliances=[[Emissaries of Evil]] |partners=La Concierge |aliases= |supports= |powers = |cat = super |subcat = Marvel Comics |hero = y |sortkey = Synapse (Max Mullins) |}} Max Mullins has the ability to rewire and alter a person's brainwaves to his liking. Taking on the name Synapse he, along with La Concierge and [[Stilt-Man]], were recruited by the [[Kingpin (character)|Kingpin]] to form the third incarnation of the [[Emissaries of Evil]]. One of the first things he did was shut down Stilt-Man's brain, albeit temporarily, so that he would not reveal his employer's name to [[Daredevil (Marvel Comics character)|Daredevil]], who at the time was acting as an agent for [[S.H.I.E.L.D.]] and had his mind wiped to think he was Laurent Levasseur.''Daredevil'' #377 While La Concierge was battling Laurent, Synapse was holding Dr. Claudia DuBois hostage along with [[Kingpin (character)|Wilson Fisk]]. Tired of being pushed around, Synapse planned on using his powers on Fisk, but Fisk, who had a stronger mind, knew of Synapse's plot and threatened to kill him if he did not continue to work under him.''Daredevil'' #378 Eventually, Fisk has Synapse use his powers on Laurent, but it instead reminds him that he is Daredevil. He knocks out Synapse with one kick.''Daredevil'' #379 {{-}} ===Emily Guerrero=== {{expand section|date=January 2018}} {{Infobox comics character |image= |caption= |character_name=Synapse |real_name=Emily Guerrero |publisher=[[Marvel Comics]] |debut=''Uncanny Avengers'' Vol. 3 #1 (December 2015) |creators=Gerry Duggan (writer)
Ryan Stegman (artist) |species=[[Inhumans|Inhuman]] |homeworld= |alliances=[[Uncanny Avengers]] |partners= |aliases= |supports= |powers =Superhuman strength
Enhanced speed
Telepathy
Animal control |cat = super |subcat = Marvel Comics |hero = y |sortkey = Synapse (Emily Guerrero) |}} Emily Guerrero lived with her younger brother and grandfather, Ivan, when the Terrigen Cloud affected their area. Emily emerged as an [[Inhumans|Inhuman]] while her grandfather also emerged where he took the name Shredded Man.''Uncanny Avengers'' Vol. 3 #4 Later, she joined the Avengers Unity Division under [[Captain America]]'s leadership. Despite being new, Steve Rogers had faith in her even though she and teammate [[Rogue (comics)|Rogue]] did not get along very well. She fought [[Super-Adaptoid]] by getting a flock of pigeons to take it out.''Uncanny Avengers'' Vol. 3 #1 {{-}} ==Powers and abilities== The Emily Guerrero version of Synapse possesses telepathy, animal control, enhanced speed and super strength. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://marvel.wikia.com/wiki/Max_Mullins_(Earth-616) Synapse (Max Mullins)] at Marvel Wiki * [http://marvel.wikia.com/wiki/Emily_Guerrero_(Earth-616) Synapse (Emily Guerrero)] at Marvel Wiki *[http://www.marvunapp.com/Appendix8/synapsedd.htm Max Mullins' profile in the Appendix to the Marvel Handbook] *[http://www.marvunapp.com/Appendix8/synapseemily.htm Emily Guerrero's profile in the Appendix to the Marvel Handbook] {{Inhumans}} {{Daredevil}} [[Category:Articles about multiple fictional characters]] [[Category:Avengers (comics) characters]] [[Category:Characters created by Scott Lobdell]] [[Category:Comics characters introduced in 1998]] [[Category:Comics characters introduced in 2015]] [[Category:Inhumans]] [[Category:Marvel Comics characters who can move at superhuman speeds]] [[Category:Marvel Comics characters with superhuman strength]] [[Category:Marvel Comics female superheroes]] [[Category:Marvel Comics male supervillains]] [[Category:Marvel Comics superheroes]] [[Category:Marvel Comics supervillains]] [[Category:Marvel Comics telepaths]]
